clinical.table_description: Medical history events containing symptoms, signs, and diagnoses entered on the GP system. Coded using Read codes, with prospective mapping to SNOMED CT codes since April 2018.

adid.description: Description: Identifier that allows additional information to be retrieved for this event, when used in combination with pracid. A value of 0 signifies that there is no additional information associated with the event., Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Additional Details Identifier, Mapping: Link Additional Clinical Details table
adid.name: adid

consid.description: Description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Consultation Identifier, Mapping: Link Consultation table
consid.name: consid

constype.description: Description: Code for the category of event recorded within the GP system (e.g. diagnosis or symptom), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Consultation type, Mapping: Lookup SED
constype.name: constype

enttype.description: Description: Identifier that represents the structured data area in Vision where the data was entered, Type: INTEGER, Format: 5, Field Name: Entity type, Mapping: Lookup Entity
enttype.name: enttype

episode.description: Description: Episode type for a specific clinical event, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Episode, Mapping: Lookup EPI
episode.name: episode

eventdate.description: Description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Event Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
eventdate.name: eventdate

medcode.description: Description: CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Medical Code, Mapping: Lookup Medical Dictionary
medcode.name: medcode

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

sctdescid.description: Description: When direct selection and entry of SNOMED CT terms is permitted this will contain the description ID of the selected term. This field will be NULL when map type = 4 (data entered as Read code), Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED description ID, Mapping: None
sctdescid.name: sctdescid

sctexpression.description: Description: A placeholder for SNOMED CT post-coordinated expressions. This is not supported in early phases of SNOMED implementation., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED Expression, Mapping: None
sctexpression.name: sctexpression

sctid.description: Description: The mapped SNOMED CT Concept ID. mapping is conducted prior to data transfer and will vary by mapping version used., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED CT Concept ID3, Mapping: None
sctid.name: sctid

sctisassured.description: Description: Indicates whether the Read to SNOMED mapping has been verified by a panel of physicians, Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Assured, Mapping: None
sctisassured.name: sctisassured

sctisindicative.description: Description: Reserved for use when systems write SNOMED CT terms natively. Used to indicate the reliability of the reverse SNOMED CT-Read map. Where SNOMED CT codes do not have a direct mapping to READ, the code ‘Rz…00’ will be utilised., Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Indicative, Mapping: None
sctisindicative.name: sctisindicative

sctmaptype.description: Description: Indicates the native encoding of the record in the Vision software (4 = term selected from Read dictionary, 5 = term selected from SNOMED CT), Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: SNOMED mapping type, Mapping: None
sctmaptype.name: sctmaptype

sctmapversion.description: Description: The version of the READ-SNOMED CT mapping table applied, Type: INTEGER, Format: 10, Field Name: SNOMED mapping Version, Mapping: None
sctmapversion.name: sctmapversion

staffid.description: Description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: Link Staff table
staffid.name: staffid

sysdate.description: Description: Date the event was entered into Vision, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: System Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
sysdate.name: sysdate

consultation.table_description: Information relating to the type of consultation entered by the GP, linked to events via the consultation identifier (consid).

consid.description: Description: The consultation identifier linking events at the same consultation, when used in combination with pracid, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Consultation Identifier, Mapping: Link Event tables
consid.name: consid

constype.description: Description: type of consultation (e.g. Surgery Consultation, Night Visit, Emergency etc.), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Consultation type, Mapping: Lookup COT
constype.name: constype

duration.description: Description: The length of time (minutes) between the opening, and closing of the consultation record, Type: INTEGER, Format: 10, Field Name: Duration, Mapping: None
duration.name: duration

eventdate.description: Description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Event Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
eventdate.name: eventdate

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

staffid.description: Description: The identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: Link Staff table
staffid.name: staffid

sysdate.description: Description: Date the event was entered into Vision, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: System Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
sysdate.name: sysdate

immunisation.table_description: Details of immunisation records on the GP system.

batch.description: Description: Immunisation batch number, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Batch Number, Mapping: Lookup BatchNumber
batch.name: batch

compound.description: Description: Immunisation compound administered – may be a single or multicomponent preparation, e.g. MMR, Type: INTEGER, Format: 4, Field Name: Compound, Mapping: Lookup IMC
compound.name: compound

consid.description: Description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Consultation Identifier, Mapping: Link Consultation table
consid.name: consid

constype.description: Description: Code for the category of event recorded within the GP system (e.g. intervention), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Consultation type, Mapping: Lookup SED
constype.name: constype

eventdate.description: Description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Event Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
eventdate.name: eventdate

immstype.description: Description: Individual components of an immunisation, e.g. Mumps, Rubella, Measles, Type: INTEGER, Format: 4, Field Name: type, Mapping: Lookup IMT
immstype.name: immstype

medcode.description: Description: CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Medical Code, Mapping: Lookup Medical Dictionary
medcode.name: medcode

method.description: Description: Route of administration for the immunisation, e.g. Oral, Intramuscular, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Method, Mapping: Lookup IME
method.name: method

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

reason.description: Description: Reason for administering the immunisation, e.g. Routine measure, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Reason, Mapping: Lookup RIN
reason.name: reason

sctdescid.description: Description: When direct selection and entry of SNOMED CT terms is permitted this will contain the description ID of the selected term. This field will be NULL when map type = 4 (data entered as Read code), Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED description ID, Mapping: None
sctdescid.name: sctdescid

sctexpression.description: Description: A placeholder for SNOMED CT post-coordinated expressions. This is not supported in early phases of SNOMED implementation., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED Expression, Mapping: None
sctexpression.name: sctexpression

sctid.description: Description: The mapped SNOMED CT Concept ID. mapping is conducted prior to data transfer and will vary by mapping version used., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED CT Concept ID3, Mapping: None
sctid.name: sctid

sctisassured.description: Description: Indicates whether the Read to SNOMED mapping has been verified by a panel of physicians., Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Assured, Mapping: None
sctisassured.name: sctisassured

sctisindicative.description: Description: Reserved for use when systems write SNOMED CT terms natively. Used to indicate the reliability of the reverse SNOMED CT-Read map. Where SNOMED CT codes do not have a direct mapping to READ, the code ‘Rz…00’ will be utilised., Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Indicative, Mapping: None
sctisindicative.name: sctisindicative

sctmaptype.description: Description: Indicates the native encoding of the record in the Vision software (4 = term selected from Read dictionary, 5= term selected from SNOMED CT), Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: SNOMED mapping type, Mapping: None
sctmaptype.name: sctmaptype

sctmapversion.description: Description: The version of the READ-SNOMED CT mapping table applied, Type: INTEGER, Format: 10, Field Name: SNOMED mapping Version, Mapping: None
sctmapversion.name: sctmapversion

source.description: Description: Location where the immunisation was administered, e.g. In this practice, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Source, Mapping: Lookup INP
source.name: source

staffid.description: Description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: Link Staff table
staffid.name: staffid

stage.description: Description: Stage of the immunisation given, e.g. 1, 2, B2, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Stage, Mapping: Lookup IST
stage.name: stage

status.description: Description: Status of the immunisation e.g. Advised, Given, Refusal, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Status, Mapping: Lookup IMM
status.name: status

sysdate.description: Description: Date the event was entered into Vision, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: System Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
sysdate.name: sysdate

patient.table_description: Basic patient demographics and registration details.

accept.description: Description: Flag to indicate whether the patient has met certain quality standards: 1 = acceptable, 0 = unacceptable, Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: Acceptable Patient Flag, Mapping: Boolean
accept.name: accept

capsup.description: Description: Level of capitation supplement the patient has currently (e.g. low, medium, high), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Capitation Supplement, Mapping: Lookup CAP
capsup.name: capsup

chsdate.description: Description: Date of registration with Child Health Surveillance, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: CHS Registration Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
chsdate.name: chsdate

chsreg.description: Description: Value to indicate whether the patient is registered with Child Health Surveillance, Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: CHS Registered, Mapping: Lookup Y_N
chsreg.name: chsreg

crd.description: Description: Date the patient’s current period of registration with the practice began (date of the first ‘permanent’ record after the latest transferred out period). If there are no ‘transferred out periods’, the date is equal to ‘frd’, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Current Registration Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
crd.name: crd

deathdate.description: Description: Date of death of patient – derived using a CPRD algorithm, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Death Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
deathdate.name: deathdate

famnum.description: Description: Family ID number, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Family Number, Mapping: None
famnum.name: famnum

frd.description: Description: Date the patient first registered with the practice. If patient only has ‘temporary’ records, the date is the first encounter with the practice; if patient has ‘permanent’ records it is the date of the first ‘permanent’ record (excluding preceding temporary records), Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: First Registration Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
frd.name: frd

gender.description: Description: Patient’s gender, Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: Patient Gender, Mapping: Lookup SEX
gender.name: gender

internal.description: Description: Number of internal transfer out periods, in the patient’s registration details, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Internal Transfer, Mapping: None
internal.name: internal

marital.description: Description: Patient’s current marital status, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Marital Status, Mapping: Lookup MAR
marital.name: marital

mob.description: Description: Patient’s month of birth (for those aged under 16). 0 indicates no month set, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Birth Month, Mapping: None
mob.name: mob

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

prescr.description: Description: type of prescribing exemption the patient has currently (e.g. medical / maternity), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Prescription Exemption, Mapping: Lookup PEX
prescr.name: prescr

reggap.description: Description: Number of days missing in the patient’s registration details, Type: INTEGER, Format: 5, Field Name: Registration Gaps, Mapping: PAT_GAP2
reggap.name: reggap

regstat.description: Description: Status of registration detailing gaps and temporary patients, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Registration Status, Mapping: PAT_STAT1
regstat.name: regstat

tod.description: Description: Date the patient transferred out of the practice, if relevant. Empty for patients who have not transferred out, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Transfer Out Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
tod.name: tod

toreason.description: Description: Reason the patient transferred out of the practice. Includes 'Death' as an option, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Transfer Out Reason, Mapping: Lookup TRA
toreason.name: toreason

vmid.description: Description: Old VM id for the patient when the practice was using the VAMP system, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: VAMP Identifier, Mapping: None
vmid.name: vmid

yob.description: Description: Patient’s year of birth. This is actual year of birth e.g. 1984, Type: INTEGER, Format: 4, Field Name: Birth Year, Mapping: None
yob.name: yob

practice.table_description: Details of each practice, including region and collection information.

lcd.description: Description: Date of the last collection for the practice, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Last Collection Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
lcd.name: lcd

pracid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a specific practice in CPRD GOLD, Type: INTEGER, Format: 5, Field Name: Practice identifier, Mapping: None
pracid.name: pracid

region.description: Description: Value to indicate where in the UK the practice is based. The region denotes the ONS Region for practices within England, and the country i.e. Wales, Scotland, or Northern Ireland for the rest, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Region, Mapping: Lookup PRG
region.name: region

uts.description: Description: Date at which the practice data is deemed to be of research quality. Derived using a CPRD algorithm that primarily looks at practice death recording and gaps in the data, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Up-to-standard date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
uts.name: uts

referral.table_description: Referral details recorded on the GP system, involving patient referrals to external care centres such as hospitals. Includes specialty and referral type.

attendance.description: Description: Category describing whether the referral event is the first visit, a follow-up etc., Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Attendance type, Mapping: Lookup ATT
attendance.name: attendance

consid.description: Description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Consultation Identifier, Mapping: Link Consultation table
consid.name: consid

constype.description: Description: Code for the category of event recorded within the GP system (e.g. management or administration), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Consultation type, Mapping: Lookup SED
constype.name: constype

eventdate.description: Description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Event Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
eventdate.name: eventdate

fhsaspec.description: Description: Referral speciality according to the Family Health Services Authority (FHSA) classification, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: FHSA Speciality, Mapping: Lookup SPE
fhsaspec.name: fhsaspec

inpatient.description: Description: Classification of the type of referral, e.g. Day case, In patient, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: In Patient, Mapping: Lookup RFT
inpatient.name: inpatient

medcode.description: Description: CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Medical Code, Mapping: Lookup Medical Dictionary
medcode.name: medcode

nhsspec.description: Description: Referral speciality according to the National Health Service (NHS) classification, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: NHS Speciality, Mapping: Lookup DEP
nhsspec.name: nhsspec

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

sctdescid.description: Description: When direct selection and entry of SNOMED CT terms is permitted this will contain the description ID of the selected term. This field will be NULL when map type = 4 (data entered as Read code), Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED description ID, Mapping: None
sctdescid.name: sctdescid

sctexpression.description: Description: A placeholder for SNOMED CT post-coordinated expressions. This is not supported in early phases of SNOMED implementation., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED Expression, Mapping: None
sctexpression.name: sctexpression

sctid.description: Description: The mapped SNOMED CT Concept ID. mapping is conducted prior to data transfer and will vary by mapping version used., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED CT Concept ID3, Mapping: None
sctid.name: sctid

sctisassured.description: Description: Indicates whether the Read to SNOMED mapping has been verified by a panel of physicians, Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Assured, Mapping: None
sctisassured.name: sctisassured

sctisindicative.description: Description: Reserved for use when systems write SNOMED CT terms natively. Used to indicate the reliability of the reverse SNOMED CT-Read map. Where SNOMED CT codes do not have a direct mapping to READ, the code ‘Rz…00’ will be utilised., Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Indicative, Mapping: None
sctisindicative.name: sctisindicative

sctmaptype.description: Description: Indicates the native encoding of the record in the Vision software (4 = term selected from Read dictionary, 5= term selected from SNOMED CT), Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: SNOMED mapping type, Mapping: None
sctmaptype.name: sctmaptype

sctmapversion.description: Description: The version of the READ-SNOMED CT mapping table applied, Type: INTEGER, Format: 10, Field Name: SNOMED mapping Version, Mapping: None
sctmapversion.name: sctmapversion

source.description: Description: Classification of the source of the referral e.g. GP, Self, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Source, Mapping: Lookup SOU
source.name: source

staffid.description: Description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: Link Staff table
staffid.name: staffid

sysdate.description: Description: Date the event was entered into Vision, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: System Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
sysdate.name: sysdate

urgency.description: Description: Classification of the urgency of the referral e.g. Routine, Urgent, Type: INTEGER, Format: 2, Field Name: Urgency, Mapping: Lookup URG
urgency.name: urgency

staff.table_description: Practice staff details, with one record per member of staff.

gender.description: Description: Staff member’s gender, Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: Staff Gender, Mapping: Lookup SEX
gender.name: gender

role.description: Description: Role of the member of staff who created the event, Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Staff Role, Mapping: Lookup ROL
role.name: role

staffid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to the practice staff member entering the data, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: None
staffid.name: staffid

test.table_description: Records of test data on the GP system, coded using Read codes chosen by the GP. Test types are identified by entity types, with varying data fields.

consid.description: Description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Consultation Identifier, Mapping: Link Consultation table
consid.name: consid

constype.description: Description: Code for the category of event recorded within the GP system (e.g. examination), Type: INTEGER, Format: 3, Field Name: Consultation type, Mapping: Lookup SED
constype.name: constype

enttype.description: Description: Identifier that represents the structured data area in Vision where the data was entered, Type: INTEGER, Format: 5, Field Name: Entity type, Mapping: Lookup Entity
enttype.name: enttype

eventdate.description: Description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Event Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
eventdate.name: eventdate

medcode.description: Description: CPRD unique code for the medical term selected by the GP, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Medical Code, Mapping: Lookup Medical Dictionary
medcode.name: medcode

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

sctdescid.description: Description: When direct selection and entry of SNOMED CT terms is permitted this will contain the description ID of the selected term. This field will be NULL when map type = 4 (data entered as Read code), Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED description ID, Mapping: None
sctdescid.name: sctdescid

sctexpression.description: Description: A placeholder for SNOMED CT post-coordinated expressions. This is not supported in early phases of SNOMED implementation., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED Expression, Mapping: None
sctexpression.name: sctexpression

sctid.description: Description: The mapped SNOMED CT Concept ID. mapping is conducted prior to data transfer and will vary by mapping version used., Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: SNOMED CT Concept ID3, Mapping: None
sctid.name: sctid

sctisassured.description: Description: Indicates whether the Read to SNOMED mapping has been verified by a panel of physicians, Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Assured, Mapping: None
sctisassured.name: sctisassured

sctisindicative.description: Description: Reserved for use when systems write SNOMED CT terms natively. Used to indicate the reliability of the reverse SNOMED CT-Read map. Where SNOMED CT codes do not have a direct mapping to READ, the code ‘Rz…00’ will be utilised., Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: SCT Is Indicative, Mapping: None
sctisindicative.name: sctisindicative

sctmaptype.description: Description: Indicates the native encoding of the record in the Vision software (4 = term selected from Read dictionary, 5= term selected from SNOMED CT), Type: INTEGER, Format: 1, Field Name: SNOMED mapping type, Mapping: None
sctmaptype.name: sctmaptype

sctmapversion.description: Description: The version of the READ-SNOMED CT mapping table applied, Type: INTEGER, Format: 10, Field Name: SNOMED mapping Version, Mapping: None
sctmapversion.name: sctmapversion

staffid.description: Description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: Link Staff table
staffid.name: staffid

sysdate.description: Description: Date the event was entered into Vision, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: System Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
sysdate.name: sysdate

therapy.table_description: Details of all prescriptions (drugs and appliances) issued by the GP. Recorded using the Gemscript product code system.

bnfcode.description: Description: Code representing the chapter & section from the British National Formulary for the product selected by GP, Type: INTEGER, Format: 5, Field Name: BNF Code, Mapping: Lookup BNFCodes
bnfcode.name: bnfcode

consid.description: Description: Identifier that allows information about the consultation to be retrieved, when used in combination with pracid, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Consultation Identifier, Mapping: Link Consultation table
consid.name: consid

dosageid.description: Description: Identifier that allows dosage information on the event to be retrieved. Use the Common Dosages Lookup to obtain the anonymised dosage text and extracted numerical information such as daily dose., Type: TEXT, Format: 64, Field Name: Dosage Identifier, Mapping: Lookup Common Dosages
dosageid.name: dosageid

drugdmd.description: Description: The mapped drug DMD code, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: DMD Code, Mapping: None
drugdmd.name: drugdmd

eventdate.description: Description: Date associated with the event, as entered by the GP, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: Event Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
eventdate.name: eventdate

issueseq.description: Description: Number to indicate whether the event is associated with a repeat schedule. Value of 0 implies the event is not part of a repeat prescription. A value ≥ 1 denotes the issue number for the prescription within a repeat schedule, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Issue Sequence Number, Mapping: None
issueseq.name: issueseq

numdays.description: Description: Number of treatment days prescribed for a specific therapy event, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Number of Days, Mapping: None
numdays.name: numdays

numpacks.description: Description: Number of individual product packs prescribed for a specific therapy event, Type: INTEGER, Format: 8, Field Name: Number of Packs, Mapping: None
numpacks.name: numpacks

packtype.description: Description: Pack size or type of the prescribed product, Type: INTEGER, Format: 10, Field Name: Pack type, Mapping: Lookup Packtype
packtype.name: packtype

patid.description: Description: Encrypted unique identifier given to a patient in CPRD GOLD, Type: TEXT, Format: 20, Field Name: Patient Identifier, Mapping: None
patid.name: patid

prn.description: Description: Indicates if the prescription is to be supplied ‘as required’. Field available to GPs from end 2020., Type: BOOLEAN, Format: 1, Field Name: As Required, Mapping: None
prn.name: prn

prodcode.description: Description: CPRD unique code for the treatment selected by the GP, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Product Code, Mapping: Lookup Product Dictionary
prodcode.name: prodcode

qty.description: Description: Total quantity entered by the GP for the prescribed product, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Total Quantity, Mapping: None
qty.name: qty

staffid.description: Description: Identifier of the practice staff member entering the data. A value of 0 indicates that the staffid is unknown, Type: INTEGER, Format: 20, Field Name: Staff Identifier, Mapping: Link Staff table
staffid.name: staffid

sysdate.description: Description: Date the event was entered into Vision, Type: DATE, Format: DD/MM/YYYY, Field Name: System Date, Mapping: DD/MM/YYYY
sysdate.name: sysdate
